summary: Rebuild/redesign the PHONIX app completely, using references from popular apps, removing any "coming soon" elements, and ensuring all features work smoothly at production-quality polish.
architectural_notes: Plan redesign via competitive references ("reference of all apps") to guide UI/UX direction before rebuilding.
Set the app’s initial/default route to a camera-first, full-screen Camera experience on launch.
known_issues: User dissatisfaction with current app design; requests a complete change/overhaul.

existing_features.title: Redesign the entire PHONIX frontend UI/UX using a coherent “best-of popular apps” reference approach (social camera + reels/stories + gallery/editor), ensuring a consistent visual system (colors, typography, spacing, shadows, motion) across all screens and states, without changing the core feature set.

Remove any and all "Coming soon" messaging, placeholder CTAs, or non-functional UI elements across the entire app; for each item, either implement the full working flow or remove it from navigation and UI so users never encounter a dead-end.

Upgrade navigation and information architecture to match modern reference apps: keep the Camera as a first-class full-screen experience, while ensuring all other windows render in a polished app shell with predictable navigation on both mobile (bottom navigation) and desktop (sidebar).

Make all currently-present social/feed experiences production-grade by backing them with real backend persistence and retrieval (instead of purely local/mock state) for at least: stories, entertainment posts, and nearby posts, including support for creating entries, listing entries, and basic interactions (likes/comments) where the UI exposes those actions.

Harden and polish the media pipeline end-to-end: camera capture/recording, saving to backend blob storage, gallery listing, media detail preview, and handoff into Enhance/Advanced Edit/AI Tools should all be stable, fast, and error-tolerant.

Refine authentication/profile experience to match reference app expectations: seamless Internet Identity login, clear guest vs authenticated capabilities, and a polished profile setup/edit flow that never blocks navigation unexpectedly.

Create and apply one upgraded premium theme set (light/dark or multi-theme) that feels like a modern flagship app, and ensure all screens/components use it consistently (including the camera overlays, sidebar, bottom nav, cards, and dialogs).

Change the app launch flow so that the Camera is the default starting view for all users (authenticated, guest, and logged-out), and it renders as a full-screen “big camera” experience (no header/sidebar/container padding) immediately after the intro splash completes.

Remove the current automatic redirect that forces logged-out users to the Login screen on startup; instead, keep the user on the full-screen Camera and provide a clear, non-blocking authentication prompt on the camera experience (e.g., an overlay or button group) to either sign in with Internet Identity or continue as guest.

Ensure camera actions behave safely when the user is not authenticated: allow viewing the camera preview, but when the user attempts actions that require identity-backed persistence (e.g., saving captured media), show an English message explaining they must sign in to save to Gallery (or offer to continue as guest where applicable).

new_feature_requests.summary: Complete app overhaul/redesign using references from popular apps (full UI/UX changes).
Remove all "coming soon" placeholders and make all advertised features fully functional and polished.
On app launch, show a large/full-screen Camera as the default starting view (camera-first experience).
